locutie.beschrijving: A reflection on the transition of the year, focusing on the burdens of missed opportunities, the passage of time, and moral failures, grounded in the exhortation of Psalm 55.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The preacher uses the Psalm as a thematic springboard rather than a verse-by-verse exposition, focusing on the psychological state of the Psalmist.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily describes the human condition at year's end (Asserting) and invites the congregation to cast burdens (Directing), with occasional promises of God's support (Commissives).
voorbeelden: Cast thy burden upon the Lord (Directive)
The Lord will sustain those who put their trust in him (Commissive/Assertive)
We have the power to make things a little better (Assertive)

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort, reflection, and a renewed sense of hope for the coming year.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Holy Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the sermon's efficacy.

voorbeelden: At year's end we think of the road over which we have come.
It was too easy to be due to what we did.
Time like an ever rolling stream bears all its sons away.
Cast thy burden upon the Lord.
Listen: 'Oh that I had wings like a dove!'
Recapture the first strategy of Jesus.
We are amazed at how easy things were.
We wish we could call the time back.
A mood of regret might and ought to fill our hearts.
He shall sustain thee.
He shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
The Lord can make our failures... turn out to his name's glory.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly biblical but often framed as a general truth (Assertive) rather than a direct address from God to the hearer.

voorbeelden: I think serious reflection will drive us to declare...
Trustee of someone's happiness, that's what you are.
We are still counted as trusted children and heirs.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher speaks with pastoral authority but rarely uses the first-person declarative ('I announce to you').

indicatoren: Extensive descriptions of the psychological state of 'we' and 'the psalmist'.
Long anecdotal illustrations (the vaudeville girl) that describe faith rather than enacting it.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is invited to agree with the preacher's observations about life rather than being directly confronted by God's word.

missende_elementen: Specific sacramental promises addressed to the 'you' in the present moment.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration and comfort, but potentially lacking the 'event' character of a divine encounter.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High biblical fidelity, but often mediated through the third person ('He shall').
voorbeelden: He shall sustain thee.
The Lord will sustain those who put their trust in him.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Mostly 'we' (inclusive of preacher and congregation) or 'I think' (softening the claim).

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used primarily in the context of the Psalm quote or moral responsibility ('You can actually throw a little sunshine').

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance where the hearer observes examples of faith rather than being the subject of the act.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Reflecting on the past year and biblical history.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about God and human nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The immediate moment of the 'turning of the year'.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from the burden (Assertive) to the promise of the Psalm (Commissive) to the call to cast (Directive).
voorbeelden: We have the burden... Cast thy burden... He shall sustain thee.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The sequence is correct, but the 'Declarative' link (the actual lifting of the burden by the word) is weak.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: The Lord will sustain those who put their trust in him... In humble repentance, we can cast our cares.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is highly effective at providing comfort through biblical promises, but it functions more as a 'reminder' of what God does rather than a 'sacramental event' where God does it through the speaking.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: We think of the road over which we have come...
sterke_punten.effect: Creates immediate connection with the hearer's experience.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I think serious reflection will drive us to declare...

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a moving speech, but the 'event' is hindered by the descriptive 'talking about' the year and the psalmist.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'I forgive you' or 'God here and now releases you' declarative force.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the promises, but the preacher acts more as a witness than a mouthpiece.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Moderate. The preacher speaks on behalf of the 'royal order'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The psalmist's word ought to speak to us.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's 'serious reflection'.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon points to grace but does not explicitly claim to be the vehicle of it.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Low. The language is more reflective/poetic than epiphanic.
tekstueel_bewijs: Good gossip about God's goodness is the missing note.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'we think', 'we feel', and 'it seems'. Needs more 'God says', 'I promise you', and 'You are'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: I think the psalmist's word ought to speak to us.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Hear now the Word of God for you: Cast your burden on Him!
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a suggestion to a direct illocutionary command.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are framed as general biblical facts.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Address the promise directly to the 'you' of the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who are spent: He promises to sustain you this very moment.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Overuse of 'we' can dilute the personal address.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' more frequently in the application phases.
voorbeeldzinnen: You cannot call the year back, but God meets you in your failure.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ensure the 'indicative' is not just a fact, but a 'declarative' act.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is homiletically beautiful and pastorally sensitive. By shifting from 'talking about' the year to 'proclaiming into' the hearer's life, it could move from a reflection to a transformative event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' of regret; SAT focuses on the 'Commissives' that bind God to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the use of the Nat Cole and Mendelssohn quotes; SAT asks if those quotes function as 'Assertives' or 'Declaratives'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the preacher's frequent use of 'I think' functions as a 'hedge' that weakens the illocutionary force of the proclamation.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - this is the performative core.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I think serious reflection will drive us to declare...

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'we' perspective, which creates solidarity but can avoid the 'I-Thou' encounter necessary for a sacramental event.
